briefdescription.para: Debugger for plotting samples, printing output, etc.
Holds the current state of the decoder (state machine).
The complex ideal downchirp.
The instantaneous frequency of the ideal downchirp.
The complex ideal upchirp.
The instantaneous frequency of the ideal upchirp.
The instantaneous frequency of the ideal upchirp.
Vector containing the FFT resuls.
Vector containing the FFT decimation.
Vector containing the FFT decimation.
The Spreading Factor.
The receiver bandwidth (fixed to 125kHz).
LoRa PHY header.
The MAC CRC.
Indicator of how many bits are transferred each second.
The number of samples to skip in DecoderState::PAUSE.
The number of samples taken per second by GNU Radio.
Indicator of how many symbols (read: chirps) are transferred each second.
The number of bits each of the symbols contain.
The number of samples in one symbol.
Period of the symbol.
Indicates in how many parts or bins a symbol is decimated, i.e. the max value to decode out of one payload symbol.
Indicates in how many parts or bins a HDR symbol is decimated, i.e. the max value to decode out of one HDR symbol.
The number of symbols needed to decode the payload. Calculated from an indicator in the HDR.
The number of words after decoding the HDR or payload. Calculated from an indicator in the HDR.
Indicates how many times the correlation failed. After some tries, the state will revert to DecoderState::DETECT.
The absolute threshold to distinguish signal from noise.
A pointer to the whitening sequence to be used in decoding. Determined by the SF in the ctor.
Vector containing the demodulated words.
Vector containing the words after deinterleaving.
Vector containing the words after deshuffling.
Vector containing the words after dewhitening.
Vector containing the words after Hamming decode or the final decoded words.
The LiquidDSP::FFT_Plan.
The LiquidDSP::FFT_Plan in reverse.
The number of samples (data points) in each bin.
An estimation for the current Center Frequency Offset.
Indicates how fast the frequency changes in a symbol (chirp).

PPM value of the data.

briefdescription.para: Correct the shift of the given symbol to match the ideal upchirp by sliding cross correlating.

parameterdescription.para: The symbol to shift.
The window in which the symbol can be shifted (length of given sample array).
The new start index in the window for the found upchirp.

briefdescription.para: Base method to start downchirp correlation and return the correlation coefficient.

parameterdescription.para: The complex array of samples to detect a downchirp in.
Length of said sample.

briefdescription.para: Base method to start upchirp detection by calling sliding_norm_cross_correlate_upchirp. Sets up the instantaneous frequency of the given complex symbol.

parameterdescription.para: The complex array of samples to detect an upchirp in.
Length of said sample.
The index to shift with so the upchirp is correctly synced inside its window.

memberdef.argsstring: (const gr_complex *samples_1, const gr_complex *samples_2, const uint32_t window)
memberdef.name: cross_correlate

briefdescription.para: Returns the correlation coefficient when correlating the given complex symbols in the given window.

parameterdescription.para: The first complex symbol to correlate with.
The second complex symbol to correlate with.
The window in which to perform correlation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *samples_ifreq, const std::vector< float > &ideal_chirp, const uint32_t to_idx)
memberdef.name: cross_correlate_ifreq

briefdescription.para: Returns the correlation coefficient of a real signal. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-correlation#Normalized_cross-correlation.

parameterdescription.para: The instantaneous frequency of the symbol to correlate with.
The vector containing the ideal chirp to correlate with.
Correlation end index.

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the bin containing the frequency change by using FFT.

parameterdescription.para: The complex symbol to analyse.

briefdescription.para: Determine the center frequency offset in the given symbol.

parameterdescription.para: The complex symbol to analyse.

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the bin containing the frequency change.

parameterdescription.para: The complex symbol to analyze.

briefdescription.para: Demodulate the given symbol and return true if all expected symbols have been parsed.

parameterdescription.para: The complex symbol to demodulate.
Whether the demodulated words were from the HDR.

briefdescription.para: Deinterleave the raw demodulated words by reversing the interleave pattern.

parameterdescription.para: The number of words that zere interleaved. Depends on SF.

briefdescription.para: The process of decoding the demodulated words to get the actual payload. 1. Deshuffle the words 2. Dewhiten the words 3. Hamming decoding.

parameterdescription.para: Whether the demodulated words were from the HDR.

briefdescription.para: Deshuffle the demodulated words by the given pattern.

parameterdescription.para: The order in which the bits appear.
Whether the demodulated words were from the HDR.

briefdescription.para: Dewhiten the deshuffled words by XORing with the whitening sequence.

parameterdescription.para: The whitening sequence to XOR with.

briefdescription.para: Use Hamming to decode the dewhitened words. - CR 4 or 3: Hamming(8,4) or Hamming(7,4) with parity correction - CR 2 or 1: Extract data only (can only find parity errors, not correct them)

parameterdescription.para: Decoding for the header?

briefdescription.para: Extract only the data in the given bytes.

parameterdescription.para: Decoding for the header?

briefdescription.para: Hamming(8,4) decoding by calling hamming_decode_soft_byte on each byte. Each byte is decoded in pairs, the first one becoming the LSB nibble and the second one the MSB nibble (if even; else just zeroes).

parameterdescription.para: Decoding for the header?

briefdescription.para: Reverse the nibbles for each byte in the given array. MSB LSB nibbles > LSB MSB

parameterdescription.para: The array of bytes to reverse the nibbles in.
Length of said array.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *values, const uint32_t len, const float mean)
memberdef.name: stddev

briefdescription.para: Return the standard deviation for the given array. Used for cross correlating.

parameterdescription.para: The array to calculate the standard deviation for.
Length of said array.
The mean (average) of the values in the array.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the instantaneous phase for the given complex symbol.

parameterdescription.para: The complex array to calculate the instantaneous phase for.
The output float array containing the instantaneous phase.
The size of said arrays.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the instantaneous frequency for the given complex symbol.

parameterdescription.para: The complex array to calculate the instantaneous frequency for.
The output float array containing the instantaneous frequency.
The size of said arrays.

briefdescription.para: TODO.
Default constructor.

parameterdescription.para: The sample rate of the input signal given to work later.
The expected spreqding factor.

briefdescription.para: The main method called by GNU Radio to perform tasks on the given input.

parameterdescription.para: The requested amoutn of output items.
An array with samples to process.
An array to return processed samples.

simplesect.para: Returns the number of output items generated.

briefdescription.para: Set th current spreading factor. **Currently not supported, restart GNU Radio with different settings instead.**.

parameterdescription.para: The new spreading factor.

briefdescription.para: Set the current sample rate. **Currently not supported, restart GNU Radio with different settings instead.**.

parameterdescription.para: The new sample rate.

briefdescription.para: Set the absolute threshold to distinguish signal from noise. Should be around 0.01f (default) for normal environments, or as low as 0.001f for the very noise-resistant USRP.

parameterdescription.para: The new threshold value.

briefdescription.para: Return the DecoderState as string for debugging purposes.

parameterdescription.para: The state to return to string. LoRa Decoder The main class for the LoRa decoder. Contains all variables and methods necessary for succesfully decoding LoRa PHY. Only the sample rate and spreading factor are needed. The other settings, like packet length and coding rate, are extracted from the (explicit) HDR.
